question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/utils/random.rs] [All Functions] [Validator collusion] Can colluding validators (< 1/3 Byzantine) combine their RNG outputs to bias the collective DKG randomness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/utils/random.rs] [Function: insecure_random_g1_points()] [Cyclic sequence] For large n, does the sequence acc.double() + shift eventually cycle, and could the cycle length be small enough to cause collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/utils/random.rs] [Function: random_scalar_from_uniform_bytes()] [Modular reduction bias] Is the bias from 512-bit to ~256-bit field negligible (< 2^-128), and have statistical tests confirmed uniform distribution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/utils/random.rs] [Function: random_128bit_scalar()] [Field element validity] Does from_bytes_le() validate that the 128-bit value is less than the scalar field order, or could large values cause field overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/utils/random.rs] [All Point Functions] [Point compression] Are points stored in compressed or uncompressed form, and could decompression failures cause DKG verification errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/utils/random.rs] [Function: random_nonzero_scalar()] [aptos_crypto dependency] Does aptos_crypto::blstrs::random_scalar_internal() properly handle the 'true' parameter for nonzero enforcement, or could a bug allow zeros? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/utils/random.rs] [Function: random_scalars()] [aptos_crypto version] Which aptos_crypto::blstrs::random_scalar() version is used, and could version skew between validators cause different random outputs? (High)
